intro: Oeosporangium patulum, commonly known as the large spore sac fern, is a unique plant belonging to the family Osmundaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive reproductive structures, which include large, sporangium-bearing leaves. The plant exhibits a primitive structure, with a central rhizome and fertile fronds that produce spores in specialized sporangia. Its spores are released in large quantities, contributing to its reproductive strategy. Oeosporangium patulum is often found in moist, shaded environments, thriving in tropical and subtropical regions.
